article.headline: Ball State 76, Kent State 67
article.story: MUNCIE, Ind. (AP) -- Terrance Chapman had 18 points and seven rebounds to lead Ball State to a 76-67 victory over Kent State on Sunday. Peyton Stovall also scored 18 points for the Cardinals (6-4, 1-1 Mid-American), who scored 22 points off 16 Kent State turnovers. Jason Edwin and Marcus Crenshaw each scored 13 points for the Golden Flashes (8-4, 1-1). Nate Gerwig had nine points and 10 rebounds for Kent State, which couldn't bounce back from a tough loss at Boston College on Wednesday. The Golden Flashes lost on a last-second shot by Craig Smith in that game, then came out flat against the Cardinals. Ball State, which got 12 points and six rebounds from Julien Mills, shot 52 percent in the first half and committed just 12 turnovers in the game. The fast start was what Ball State coach Tim Buckley wanted to see after watching his team fall behind 17-2 in the first five minutes of a 71-59 loss at Indiana on Tuesday.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
